chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?
items.plainText: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

items.text: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
items.plainText: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

items.text: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.
items.plainText: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.

items.text: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.
items.plainText: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.

items.text: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?
items.plainText: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

items.text: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.
items.plainText: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.

items.text: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.
items.plainText: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.

items.text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.
items.plainText: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

items.text: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?
items.plainText: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?

items.text: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?
items.plainText: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

items.text: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?
items.plainText: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

items.text: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?
items.plainText: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?

items.text: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?
items.plainText: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?

items.text: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,
items.plainText: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

items.text: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.
items.plainText: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

items.text: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;
items.plainText: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;

items.text: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
items.plainText: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.

items.text: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.
items.plainText: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.

items.text: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?
items.plainText: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?

items.text: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.
items.plainText: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.

items.text: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.
items.plainText: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.

items.text: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.
items.plainText: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.

items.text: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.
items.plainText: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.

items.text: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.
items.plainText: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.

items.text: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
items.plainText: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

items.text: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?
items.plainText: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?

items.text: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?
items.plainText: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?

items.text: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.
items.plainText: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.

items.text: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.
items.plainText: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.

items.text: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
items.plainText: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
